title: Bangabandhu Dhaka Marathon 2026
details: The Bangabandhu Dhaka Marathon is an international marathon event held annually in Dhaka to commemorate the birth centenary of Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, the founding father of Bangladesh. Organized by the Bangladesh Army in collaboration with various national bodies, the marathon promotes health, fitness, and international sporting spirit. It features several categories including full marathon, half marathon, 10 km run, wheelchair race, and a virtual marathon for global participants. The event attracts professional and amateur runners from both home and abroad, offering prize money, medals, and certificates. Beyond being a competitive race, it serves as a unifying celebration of national pride, inclusivity, and the enduring legacy of Bangabandhu.

title: Beer Marathon 2025
details: Engaging in sports is not only about staying fit 🏋️ but also about indulging 😏. Fans of good food and drink, in other words, the bon vivants, will feel right at home in the malt at the Beer Marathon. The mission here is to break the mold! 💥 Who says you can't have fun while running? 🤔 Enjoy the company of fellow participants who are in the same festive spirit as you and, hopefully, embraced the theme of costuming! Yes, this festive competition 🎉 encourages participants to sport their fanciest outfits. It’s highly recommended! Ever seen Shrek run a half-marathon while enjoying a Pelforth? 🧌 A mixture like this, of visual, physical, and taste sensations, is not to be missed! But, be wary of weighing down your stomach, as that would quickly turn the fun into a nightmare 😂. Knowing your limits is key!

title: July 4th Freedom Run-KANSAS CITY 2025
location: Kansas City (Jackson County, Missouri, United States)
details: In the American calendar, July 4th 💐 is an important date as it marks the commemoration of the declaration of independence in 1776, from Great Britain 🇬🇧. This national holiday celebrates with fireworks 🎇, patriotic songs, and barbecues 🍗. But a holiday also means an opportunity to put on a bib! 🎽 Meet in Kansas City to participate in the July 4th Freedom Run 🚏, a relaxed race with the sole purpose of gathering with family or friends 🫶. Beyond the finish line, the clear goal is to have a good sporting time 💪. Windy streets along the iconic Missouri River and vast parks. Since everyone has different levels of enjoyment, the organization has planned several formats: 5 km, 10 km, and a half-marathon 🌆. Everything is in place to properly celebrate this national day. If you've come with your family, a 1-mile (1.61 km) 🏃‍♀️ course is on the list of festivities. Oh yeah! If you haven't found what suits you, don't worry, the race is also available in connected version 📲.

title: Ultra Trail Gaspesia 100 2025
details: The Ultra Trail Gaspesia 100 (UTG100) is a premier trail running event held annually in Percé, Quebec, Canada. Celebrating its 10th edition from June 13 to 15, 2025, the UTG100 offers a unique running experience through the scenic landscapes of the Gaspésie region, including the UNESCO Global Geopark of Percé and the Parc national de l’Île-Bonaventure-et-du-Rocher-Percé . The event features a variety of races to accommodate runners of all levels, ranging from ultra-endurance distances of 100 miles, 110 km, 85 km, and 55 km, to shorter trail runs of 35 km, 25 km, 15 km, and 5 km . Additionally, the Trans-Percé stage races offer cumulative distances of 25 km, 50 km, and 100 km over three days. Participants traverse single-track trails that showcase breathtaking views of landmarks such as Rocher-Percé, Bonaventure Island, and the Gulf of St. Lawrence . The UTG100 is renowned for its challenging courses, festive atmosphere, and the warm hospitality of the Gaspé community

title: The Klondike Ultra 2025
location: Fort Assiniboine (Comté de Woodlands, Alberta, Canada)
details: The Klondike Ultra 2025 is an exhilarating trail running event scheduled for June 7, 2025, in the scenic Fort Assiniboine Sandhills Wildland Provincial Park, Alberta, Canada. Organized by Wildland Sports, the event offers a range of distances to cater to various skill levels, including the Klondike Kids 6 km, Klondike Rush 10 km, The Dead Horse 27 km, Little Klondike 50 km, and the flagship Klondike Ultra 100 km race. Participants will traverse diverse terrains featuring ancient sand dunes, moss-covered boreal forests, and historic wagon trails alongside the Athabasca River. The 100 km race presents a challenging elevation gain of approximately 2,880 meters, with a 17-hour time limit and a mandatory checkpoint cutoff at 2:00 PM for the first 50 km lap . All runners are required to carry bear spray and a hydration device, emphasizing safety and environmental responsibility. The event fosters a community spirit, offering amenities like fully stocked aid stations, finisher medals, and prize.
